name: libffs

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

variants.name: generator
variants.description: the build system generator to use

description:
FFS is a middleware library for data communication, including
representation, processing and marshaling that preserves the performance
of traditional approaches while relaxing the requirement of a priori
knowledge and providing complex run-time flexibility.

dependencies.name: cmake
dependencies.description:
A cross-platform, open-source build system. CMake is a family of tools
designed to build, test and package software.

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: ninja
dependencies.description:
Ninja is a small build system with a focus on speed. It differs from
other build systems in two major respects: it is designed to have its
input files generated by a higher-level build system, and it is designed
to run builds as fast as possible.

dependencies.name: flex
dependencies.description: Flex is a tool for generating scanners.

dependencies.name: bison
dependencies.description:
Bison is a general-purpose parser generator that converts an annotated
context-free grammar into a deterministic LR or generalized LR (GLR)
parser employing LALR(1) parser tables.

dependencies.name: gtkorvo-cercs-env
dependencies.description: A utility library used by some GTkorvo packages.

dependencies.name: gtkorvo-atl
dependencies.description:
Libatl provides a library for the creation and manipulation of lists of
name/value pairs using an efficient binary representation.

dependencies.name: gtkorvo-dill
dependencies.description:
DILL provides instruction-level code generation, register allocation and
simple optimizations for generating executable code directly into memory
regions for immediate use.

dependent_to.name: libevpath
dependent_to.description:
EVpath is an event transport middleware layer designed to allow for the
easy implementation of overlay networks, with active data processing,
routing and management at all points in the overlay. EVPath is designed
for high performance systems.
